definition: to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: John has a windfall . It surprises his wife greatly .
sentences.chinese: 约翰意外获得一笔财富，使他夫人大吃一惊。

sentences.english: I was frightened at the sound.
sentences.chinese: 我听到那声音不禁大吃一惊。

sentences.english: The next day morning, the professor would be surprised to open the door.
sentences.chinese: 次日一早，教授打开屋门便大吃一惊。
我知道你会对此大吃一惊。

sentences.english: That news really bowled over his friends.
sentences.chinese: 那个消息真使他的朋友们大吃一惊。

sentences.english: If you think that everybody is journaling, then you are in for a surprise.
sentences.chinese: 如果你认为人人都在写日志，那你就要大吃一惊了。

sentences.english: Her scream brought me up short.
sentences.chinese: 她的尖叫使我大吃一惊。

sentences.english: Only once did Cosette make a mistake and alarm him.
sentences.chinese: 只有一次，珂赛特失误了，使他大吃一惊。

sentences.english: My children are left stunned, my husband bewildered and my friends unsupportive.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们大吃一惊，丈夫疑惑不解，朋友们也不支持。

sentences.english: You coulda knocked me over with feather when I heard the news.
sentences.chinese: 我听到这个消息时真是大吃一惊。

sentences.english: No. No, I want to surprise him and Mr. Crawley.
sentences.chinese: 没有，我要让他和克劳先生大吃一惊。

sentences.english: My jaw dropped when I see how much the meal have cost.
sentences.chinese: 看到那顿饭要花这么多钱，我大吃一惊。

sentences.english: I said, shocked at his godless indifference.
sentences.chinese: 我说，听到他对神这样漠视大吃一惊。

sentences.english: To her horror he said that she was two hours too soon.
sentences.chinese: 搬运工说她早到了两个小时，她听后大吃一惊。

sentences.english: I was astonished when hearing these words and realized the Bodhisattva in my dream was Manjusri indeed.
sentences.chinese: 我这会儿才大吃一惊，原来那梦里真是文殊菩萨。

sentences.english: A few shovel loads later, the farmer looked down the well, and was astonished at what he saw.
sentences.chinese: 又铲了几下土之后，农夫看了看井底，大吃一惊。

definition: to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
to be pleased beyond one's expectations (idiom)/overjoyed at the turn of events
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
to cry out in alarm or surprise
